ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: For he thinks he is sufficient in himself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: for he believes himself to be self-sufficient.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: because he thinks that he is independent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Because he sees himself free from want.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: when he considers himself without need.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: In that he looketh upon himself as self-sufficient.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [96:7] when he sees it, that is to say, his own soul, to be self-sufficient, in terms of wealth — this was revealed regarding Abū Jahl (ra’ā, ‘sees’, means [to see] mentally; istaghnā, ‘self-sufficient’, is the second direct object; an ra’āhu, ‘when he sees it’, is an object denoting reason).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (That he thinketh himself independent) of Allah because of his wealth! 764
